TEXT: The applicant is a national of GPE , born in DATE . At present he is imprisoned . Previously he resided in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case may be summarised as follows .

The applicant came to GPE in DATE and applied for asylum . He stated that he had not been involved in any direct political activities in GPE but that he had encountered problems due to his NORP origin . He maintained furthermore that he had assisted the resistance movement by transporting necessities of life to people in the NORP province . The applicant was considered a de facto refugee by the NORP authorities , and was granted a permanent residence permit . His request for a travel document and a declaration of refugee status was , however , rejected .

The applicant was convicted of theft in DATE and of petty larceny and aggravated assault in DATE . For the last two crimes he was , on DATE , sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment by ORG ( tingsrätten ) of GPE .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of attempted manslaughter ( försök till dråp ) . He was sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . As regards the question of expulsion the court found , with its chairman and CARDINAL of the lay assessors dissenting that , being of NORP origin from the NORP province , the applicant would risk persecution if he returned to GPE . The court , therefore , did not issue an expulsion order also bearing in mind that the applicant had resided in GPE since DATE .

The applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG ( hovrätten ) . During the proceedings before ORG the court obtained an opinion from ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) as to the applicant ’s need for protection . In its opinion of DATE the ORG submitted that it had formed its opinion on the basis of an overall assessment of the political situation in GPE . The assessment was founded on several reports from the NORP foreign administration covering the political situation after DATE of the PERSON regime in DATE . According to those reports the human rights situation had improved considerably . A new Constitution had been adopted in DATE which established , both generally and in detail , that human rights should be respected . ORG had also signed all essential conventions on human rights . The Board therefore considered that the applicant was no longer in need of protection in GPE .

On DATE ORG , at the same time reviewing the judgment of DATE , sentenced the applicant to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment to be followed by expulsion . The ORG took into consideration , inter alia , that the applicant during DATE had committed CARDINAL serious crimes of violence , that it could be assumed that he would pursue his criminal activities in GPE if he was allowed to stay there , that he , whilst residing in GPE , had been working for only a limited time , that he did not have any relatives in GPE and that he had not learned NORP although he had been living in the country for DATE . Furthermore the court took into consideration ORG opinion that the applicant , due to the new conditions in GPE , was no longer in need of protection in GPE as a de facto refugee .
The applicant appealed to ORG ( ORG domstolen ) . On DATE he was refused leave to appeal .
On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s petition to have the expulsion order revoked .
The applicant may be released on probation on DATE at the earliest . An expulsion may take place as from that date . The enforcement will be carried out by the local police authority .
